epfl.lia.logist.agent
Class AgentManager

java.lang.Object
  epfl.lia.logist.agent.AgentManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
IService
public class AgentManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements IService

The AgentManager class handles the management of agents. This class is responsible for creating, updating and killing agents.

setup

public void setup(Configuration cfg,
                  LogistGlobals lg)
           throws java.lang.Exception
Sets the manager up. This method asks the creation of agents from the disk (from descriptor). It starts by creating the root agent first, and then it continues with children.

Specified by:
setup in interface IService
Parameters:
cfg - the global configuration object
lg - an object holding globals
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

reset

public void reset(int round)
Reset all agents This method calls the respective reset() method for all agents. Agents will then be sent a RESET message.

Specified by:
reset in interface IService
Parameters:
round - the current round number

addListener

public void addListener(IAgentListener acl)
Add a new listener. Adds a new listener. A listener is invoked when an agent is created, deleted or changed. This allows classes depending on agents to use only a list, thus having no need to duplicate data. For example, the service responsible for displaying agents will register as a listener. When a new agent is created, this service is immediately informed !

Parameters:
acl - the listener object

initAllAgents

public void initAllAgents()
Initializes all agents in the simulation This method sends a INIT message to all agents. When the agent receives the message, it has then a certain amount of time to initialize whatever it has to initialize.

notifyTaskBatchCreation

public void notifyTaskBatchCreation()
Notifies the batch creation. Agents are notified everytime a task batch is happened to the system.

killAllAgents

public void killAllAgents()
Kills all agents in the simulation This method sends a KILL message to all agents. When the agent receives the message, it has then a certain amount of time before simulation ends. This little delay allows writing files to disk, etc.. etc...

resetAllAgents

public void resetAllAgents(int round)
Send a global request to reset This method is invoked at the end of a round in a multi-round simulation. If tells agents which round is starting.

removeAgent

public void removeAgent(AgentProfile ap)
Remove an agent from the disk This method removes an agent from the manager's lists. It is killed and everything it has done is written to disk( history, etc...). The agent is first put in a schedule list and is killed in next time step.

Parameters:
ap - the profile object to kill

verifyScheduledAgents

public void verifyScheduledAgents()
Verify if there is any agent which should be killed Once agent manager is requested to remove a particular agent, this agent is put in a scheduled list which elements will be discarded on the next time step. This is necessary in order to avoid concurrent list modificated.
